html: Those of Jehovah’s people who didn’t prove valiant but who still survived into the millennial age recount their times of distress when Jehovah’s chastisements impelled them to turn back to him. At the time of Jehovah’s coming, the whole earth goes into labor (Isaiah 13:8; 21:3; 42:14; 66:7-9). But instead of bringing forth a deliverer, or preparing the world for Jehovah’s coming as salvation, his people bring forth but wind, an allusion to the archtyrant who oppresses them. Only Jehovah’s elect bring forth a deliverer (Isaiah 7:14; 9:6-7; 11:10-12; 19:20; 41:2-3; 45:13; 48:14-15; 49:1, 5; 55:3-5; 66:7).
